item.title: Build Night: Chibitronics
item.description: Ages 13-Adults. Join us for our 2nd Build Night! Create fun LED designs using Chibitronics' light up stickers.

item.title: *Cancelled* Board Meeting
item.description: Regular Monthly Meeting of the Board of Trustees.

item.title: Chair Yoga
item.description:
Due to high demand, we offer TWO yoga sessions. Attend either the 9:30 session or the 11:00 session. Space in each session is limited to the first 64 people.


Yoga instructor Olga Rudiak leads a series of yoga sessions for improved physical strength, relaxation and mental clarity. Exercises are done in a chair or standing not on the floor.

item.title: Chair Yoga
item.description:
Due to high demand, we offer TWO yoga sessions. Attend either the 9:30 session or the 11:00 session. Space in each session is limited to the first 64 people.


Yoga instructor Olga Rudiak leads a series of yoga sessions for improved physical strength, relaxation and mental clarity. Exercises are done in a chair or standing not on the floor.

item.title: Mocha & More Teen Book Discussion: Let it Snow (grades 6-12)
item.description:
Let it Snow by John Green, Maureen Johnson, and Lauren Myracle

In three intertwining short stories, several high school couples experience the trials and tribulations along with the joys of romance during a Christmas Eve snowstorm in a small town.

Heads Up: This book has a suggested reading audience of 6-12th grade.

We meet at Sunset Foods and your first drink is on us. The first 7 registered teens to check in at the Youth Services desk get a free copy of the book

item.title: Mother Goose and Her Friends (For Families)
item.description: Full of rhyme, puppetry, and creative dramatics, this program offers young children the opportunity to participate in the “magic” of puppetry and nursery rhymes.

item.title: Illinois Poetry Society Haiku Chapter
item.description: Haiku poets of all levels are welcome. Contemporary English Language Haiku (ELH) is not the more commonly known style, yet it has retained its Japanese influence in many ways. Come and have your work critiqued, learn more about ELH techniques, and share resources.

item.title: AMC 10 Study Group
item.description:
During this weekly teen-led study group, participants will take a practice AMC 10 under test conditions for 75 minutes
and then go over the answers and select solutions. Participants must be in 9th or 10th grade, be enrolled in an honors math class and have taken the AMC 8 or 10 last year. This group will meet on October 16 and 23, November 6 and 27, December 4, 11, and 18, January 22 and 29, February 5 and 12.

item.title: Tech Tuesdays
item.description: Drop by and get help using eBooks, eAudiobooks, digital magazines, HOOPLA, and your portable device. Bring your device and any user IDs and passwords (Apple ID/password or Amazon account information). No sign up required. Find us on the 2nd floor across from the Reference Desk.

item.title: K-9 Reading Buddies (Grades 1-5)
item.description: Readers can practice their skills and build confidence by reading to a friendly dog from K-9 Reading Buddies! Space is limited, so please register in person or by phone for a 15 minute time slot.

item.title: Adult Graphic Novel Discussion: Wolverine: Old Man Logan
item.description:
Meeting at North Shore Comics on Dundee and Landwehr Road

This month, we will discuss "Old Man Logan" by Mark Millar

"In a bleak future, super-villains have won and evil reigns supreme. The brazen hero once known as Wolverine is now a husband and father who can barely pay the rent. But when he's pushed to the brink, he has to come out of hiding and do anything necessary to protect his family."

Copies are available for checkout at the Reader Services desk. If you would prefer to own a copy of this title, contact North Shore Comics and ask about their special discount for participants.

item.title: Little Explorers (Ages 2-6)
item.description: Come with an adult and learn science, engineering, and math concepts through hands-on activities, stories, and music.

item.title: Stir Crazy
item.description: Wednesday Classic Film Series Presents "Stir Crazy". Directed by Sidney Poitier, stars Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor as down-on-their-luck friends who are given 125-year prison sentences after being framed for a bank robbery.

item.title: Serial Readers (grades 4-6); Sammy Keyes and the Hotel Thief
item.description: Come join us for a fun discussion while enjoying a pizza snack.

item.title: Chess Club
item.description: Join our weekly chess club and meet like-minded enthusiasts. Already on a chess team? Stop by and show us what you've got. For all skill levels. Chess sets and clocks will be provided.

item.title: Stir Crazy
item.description: Wednesday Classic Film Series Presents "Stir Crazy". Directed by Sidney Poitier, stars Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor as down-on-their-luck friends who are given 125-year prison sentences after being framed for a bank robbery.

item.description: A discussion of the history of Israel. For today's topics see northshoreflashpoints.blogspot.com.

item.title: Games Outside the Box (All Ages)
item.description: Calling all Gamers, Techies, Engineers, Builders, Strategists, Creators, Geeks and Out-of-the-Box thinkers – it’s time to play! During winter break we’ll be featuring a different game, activity, hardware or toy. Stop by and let’s see what you can do!

item.title: Pajama Stories (Families)
item.description: Put on your coziest pajamas and join us for a half hour of stories and fun!

item.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
item.description: Wednesday Classic Film Series Presents "Willy Wonka & The Chocolate Factory". When eccentric candy man Willy Wonka (Gene Wilder) promises a lifetime supply of sweets and a tour of his chocolate factory to five lucky kids, penniless Charlie Bucket (Peter Ostrum) seeks the priceless golden ticket that will make him a winner.

item.title: Noon Year's Eve Celebration (All Ages)
item.description: Join us for a New Year’s celebration where we will count down to….noon! There will be crafts, games and fun that will culminate in a dance party/balloon drop at high noon.

item.title: Classics on Wednesday Film Series - The Apartment
item.description:
Legendary director Billy Wilder at his most scathing and satirical best. Jack Lemmon plays a career-climbing executive who offers his boss the use of his apartment for an extramarital fling and gets tangled up with the boss’ flighty girlfriend (Shirley MacLaine). Winner of five Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

PRESENTED IN DCP
1960
125 minutes

item.title: Science Explorers (Gr K-2)
item.description: Are you a budding scientist just itching to experiment? Sign up to explore basic science concepts with hands on activities. Get ready to get messy and learn something too.

item.title: Teen Volunteering (high school)
item.description:
Every Wednesday in January and February, we’re offering volunteer hours for high school students in need of just a few more service hours. We’ll have jobs for 5 teens. Register for one of the spots or, if you’re feeling lucky, just stop by the Youth Services Department. Heads up - these won’t be the glamour jobs, think dusting miles of bookshelves, cleaning thousands of legos, and alphabetizing millions books.

Every Wednesday in January and February, 6-8:00 p.m., Youth Services Department

item.title: Chess Club
item.description: Join our weekly chess club and meet like-minded enthusiasts. Already on a chess team? Stop by and show us what you've got. For all skill levels. Chess sets and clocks will be provided.

item.title: Current Events
item.description: Voice your opinion and hear the opinions of others on the important events of the day. For today's topics see northshoreflashpoints.blogspot.com.

item.title: Create Club Gr.3-5
item.description: Afterschool programs for kids in grades 3-5 that focus on STEAM activities.

item.title: NSO Pre-Concert Lecture
item.description: Discover the musical treasures of the North Shore's most exciting orchestra! A special music salon with Jim Kendros, the pre-concert lecturer and composer fellow of the Northbrook Symphony. Jim will share in-depth knowledge and insights about the music at the January 15 concert. Jim will also offer mini concerts on the piano and other instruments.

item.title: Parisian Salon Concert
item.description:
To welcome and celebrate the New Year, French harpist and composer
ISABELLE OLIVIER will take us on an irresistibly joyful and magical musical trip with her critically acclaimed show: "DON'T WORRY, BE HARPY"

item.title: Messy Masterpieces (For Families)
item.description: Drop in and have some family fun! Create some cool artwork to take home from our vast array of art supplies.

item.title: Illinois Poetry Society Meeting
item.description: The Illinois State Poetry Society has a chapter that meets at the library. New members are welcome. Bring ten copies of two of your poems to share.

item.title: Open Gaming and RPG Demo at the Library
item.description: Learn about the library's new adult board game collection and receive hands-on instructions from the experienced gamers at Pastimes Comics & Games.

item.title: Monday Movers (walkers up to 24 months)
item.description: Join us for a half hour of moving, singing, reading, and fun! For toddlers with a caregiver.

item.title: Fresh off the Shelf (Grades K-2)
item.description: The latest and greatest books and hands-on activities to make them come alive!

item.title: Greatest Presidential Inauguration Speeches
item.description: On January 20 our new President will deliver our country's 58th inaugural speech. Most of the prior 57 have been disappointing, but seven have stood out--they have challenged us, lifted us, and forced us to rethink what it means to be an American. Professor Gary Midkiff will review those seven.

item.title: Friends of the Library Board Meeting
item.description: Friends of the Northbrook Public Library Board Meeting

item.title: Two-year-old Storytime (with Caregiver)
item.description: This storytime is suitable for children ages 2-3 years.

item.title: Preschool Storytime (Ages 3-5)
item.description: This storytime is suitable for children ages 3-5 years.

item.title: String Theory: X-Stitch Selfies (Gr 4-12)
item.description: Interested in learning Fiber Arts? Join us for our monthly Fiber Arts workshops. Each month we will feature a different form of Fiber Arts such as knitting, crochet, or weaving. Participants must sign up for both dates. All tools and materials will be provided by the library.

item.title: Needlework Meet Up (ages 13 and up)
item.description: Meet up with other crafters and share ideas as you work on your own projects. Be sure to bring your own materials. This is not a class, but staff will be available to discuss and guide self-directed work.

item.title: Book Discussion: Return of the Native
item.description:
Benjamin Goluboff leads a discussion of "The Return of the Native" by Thomas Hardy.


A willful woman who longs to escape the rural confines of Egdon Heath believes that by marrying a man who just returned from Paris, she will find the romance and adventure her heart craves. But his interests run in the opposite direction -- toward comfort, community, and tradition.

item.title: Classics on Wednesday Film Series - 9 to 5
item.description:
Three fed-up secretaries (Jane Fonda, Lily Tomlin, and Dolly Parton) kidnap their sexist boss (Dabney Colman) and force him to authorize office improvements.

PRESENTED in DCP
1980
Rated PG
109 minutes

item.title: Oakton Literacy Class - Spring 2017
item.description:
Meet with teachers from Oakton Community College for Adult Literacy classes. Classes are open to both native and non-native speakers of English. Regular class schedule will be Monday and Wednesday evenings from 6PM - 8:30PM. --- Registration on Wednesday, January 11th. --- CLASSES WILL NOT MEET ON: 2/20, 3/27, 3/29.

NOTE: Class will NOT meet on the following dates:

item.title: Introduction to the iPad, Part 1
item.description: We'll go over only the most basic features in using your iPad:your homescreen; downloading, opening, and closing apps; connecting to a Wi-Fi network, and more. Your iPad must be set up with iOS9. Bring your Apple ID and password.

item.title: Staying Positive in a Negative World
item.description: Jump-start your way to a more positive attitude. Motivational coach Tom Kens shares 10 fundamental practices you can use to live a healthier, happier life.
